jobTitle: AI and Innovation Scientists, Visa Predictive Models
jobDescription: Company DescriptionVisa has the worlds largest consumer payment transaction data set. We see data on over 100 billion transactions per year from all over the world. We use that data to help our clients in the payment ecosystem grow their businesses and to help consumers access a fast, safe, and rewarding payment experience.  From across the globe, people are increasingly relying on digital payments and mobile technology to use their money any time, make purchases online, transfer funds across borders and access basic financial services. To ensure that payment transactions are secure and reliable, Visa has invested heavily in advanced authentication and fraud prevention technologies, and the company continues to develop and deploy new and innovative programs to fight fraud, enable acceptance, and support consumers. We also invest heavily in helping banks and merchants understand the behavior of their customers so they can bring products and services to market that more effectively meet their customers needs.Job DescriptionVisa is one of the original digital technology companies, with an extensive network connecting tens of thousands of banks and millions of merchants. More than 60 years later we continue seek new ways to push the boundaries of payment technologies and the development of innovative payment solutions. This position reports to the VP of Models for Data and Credit and will occupy a unique space which intersects the disciplines of predictive modeling, machine learning / AI and innovative product development.  We are seeking passionate and talented AI / Machine Learning scientists and engineers to collaborate with product designers in Visas suite of global Innovation Labs. You will be part of a multi-disciplinary team collaborating with business, design and development professionals. You will blur the lines between business strategy, creativity, computer science and deep learning algorithms helping to leverage Visa data to enhance new solutions, such as connected homes, connected cars and IoT.  We are currently recruiting for two open roles. These roles may be located in Foster City, CA or Ashburn,VA. Ashburn team members would require periodic travel to Bay Area to meet with Innovation Lab team members.
